conversation.content: So basically I'm locked out and like, I tried my password five times already.
Oh I see, um, let me pull up your account here... hmm, what's the email associated with it?
It's sarah.chen at gmail, and like I really need to get in.
Got it, account AC-7742-B. Yeah I can see the lockout here, er, five attempts in... wow, three minutes. Let me check what's the... what's the word... the protocol for this.
*exhales* Look, basically I just need this fixed fast, I have a meeting.

Right right, so the thing is, uh, normally we'd send a reset link to your email but I'm seeing here that your recovery email bounces back—error code E401X—so let me think what else we can... hmm, okay actually I have an idea.
Wait, my recovery email is broken too? Since when?
Shows disconnected as of, er, October 12th. But here's what I can do—I'll verify you through security questions, then basically unlock it right now instead of the usual 24-hour wait period.
Oh! Like right now right now? That would actually be amazing.
Yep, immediate unlock. So first question, uh, let me see here... what's the name of your first pet?
Basically it was Mr. Whiskers, so that's the answer.
Perfect, and... hmm, your first car make and model?
Honda Civic, like the 2012 one.
Great great. Last one—ZIP code when you opened the account in 2019?
So that would be... *sharp inhale* oh wait, 94102, yeah definitely.
Excellent! Okay so, um, I'm unlocking it now... just need to... there. Account AC-7742-B is active again. What I'm also gonna do is, er, generate you a temporary password—ready to write this down?
Wait really? It's done? Yes yes, so ready for the password!
It's TEMP-8847-DELTA-3. All caps except the numbers obviously. You'll need to change it when you log in, but uh, that'll get you in right now.
This is so much better than I expected, like seriously, thank you!
No problem! Oh and, hmm, one more thing—I've added a backup authentication method using your phone ending in 7823, just so you don't get locked out again. Should be all set now.
